Reviews.Title: “Literally right at the airport!”
Reviews.Author: 007Laurie007
Reviews.Content: Very good for those travelling in and out of San Juan. Very convenient. Comfortable clean rooms, breakfast served very early for those first flights of the day. Great for short stays when taking a cruise or needing to be close for early flights. Hot tubs outside for a bit of relaxation. Laundry facilities so perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “BEST WESTERN San Juan Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvE98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after arriving on a late flight. Had made reservation on their internet site. Good price and included continental breakfast It was small but clean and bed was comfortable. Breakfast area was very clean and lots of choices of food for a continental kind of breakfast. Reception had english speaking staff, very polite and friendly. Taxi available right outside the door which we liked as we left early to go into San Juan. This hotel was very convenient for our late arriving flight and for the one night we spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jamiedavila
Reviews.Content: Right in the airport. Small rooms but offered free breakfast so that made it worth while

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferkagnew
Reviews.Content: What a place... Its literally at the airport, proximity to the terminal is about 2mins walking and the best part about this is that you dont hear the planes what so ever! The rooms are great! Not huge, but pretty nice. We stayed here about 2 years ago, but it seems to be that the owners are redoing the rooms because our room was really nice and different as to when the last time we stayed. Would greatly recommend! It also saved us a ton of money because we had an early flight that we were able to take bc we were locate right at the airport. Ask for thr oatmeal at the breakfast room. Its really good

Reviews.Title: “For a one night stay at airport....”
Reviews.Author: OHoric
Reviews.Content: We spent previous nights in Old San Juan and preferred to be on location at the airport for the last night. Our flight out was at 6h00 am, the next morning. Aside from the practicality, I can resume our stay in one word: outdated, outdated, outdated!!!! The rooms look like they were modeled based on ideas from a designer/decorator who died in the 1960's of old age. Itâ€™s almost cartoonish! The bed sheets are see-thru and you can count threads without a magnifier. The bathroom amenities are definitely from the same era and are designed so that you do not waste any time in there. If we were in the same situation again, we'd fork out a few more bucks (if any) to stay at one of the beautiful resorts in Isla Verde, only 5 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: We were unsure about making this reservation b/c some of the prior reviews had been negative. Our check in was fast and courteous. The beds were the most comfortable of our trip (we stayed in 5 different hotels during our 10 day vacation). We did not have an issue with airplane noise. The largest benefit of course was being able to turn in our rental car the day before our early morning departure. We returned the rental, took the car company's courtesy shuttle to the airport, and were set.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night after arriving around midnight and again on our last night before leaving early in the morning. In doing so we saved two days of car rental. The breakfast begins at 5:30 AM and was as good as any we had on the island. We were able to drop our luggage here early on our last day. Staff was helpful and accommodating. No surprises in the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Leslie053
Reviews.Content: We got a room here for a quick few hours sleep between flights. It was a quick check in just before midnight, and we had to leave for a 6:30 a.m. flight. The location inside the airport was great, the front desk personnel was efficient and the room was clean and comfortable. It really suite our needs, and would definitely do it again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Flight Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Triathletewithkids
Reviews.Content: My family and I took an overnight flight to San Juan. We chose this hotel because we could walk from baggage claim to the front desk and never leave the actual airport. We arrived at 2:30 AM and were at the front desk by 3 AM. I booked the room for March 20th since we were arriving in the wee hours of the morning but was told by the front desk that I should have booked it for March 19th as a late arrival. Either way, the front desk staff was able to find us a room and was even kind enough to set us up with more spacious accomodations. We took advantage of their Continental Breakfast and the accomodations were average. The only complaint I had is that the coffee maker didn't work and there was no toilet paper. I made a call to the front desk and they came by within minutes to deliver the paper. Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad! Really nice!!! Certainly will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: Well everyone, after looking up some Hotels in Puerto Rico, it came to me that there were so many options but none that called my attention. When I checked for something close to the airport, I saw that there was a Best Western at the Airport. I've stayed at many Best Western's in the past and have had a great experience. This Hotel amazed me. I stayed in a great room on the 6 floor which was separate to the other rooms. You had to take 2 elevators to get there. In addition to the room being really nice, the people at the Front Desk were excellent. My flight left early in the morning. As you know, morning flights are a TON cheaper, so, i decided to stay at the airport, had an excellent time, and was able to get to my early flight on time because the terminals were extremely close. The Hotel is literally at the Airport in the middle, but you don't hear a thing. I thought you would hear the planes, but you can't. I recommend this HOTEL to anybody who wants to stay close to everything and at an affordable price. I paid about 20% less than other hotels near by and I didn't have to pay a taxi to get to the airport. When you calculate the cost, its really nice. By the way, when you do get to stay at the Hotel, try the Oatmeal for breakfast..... REALLY GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “In Need of a Renovation”
Reviews.Author: rossq
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our cruise. We chose this hotel because of its convenient location as its right in the airport and the fact that our cruise line had given us complimentary transfers from the airport to the pier. Going in we knew that the reviews were poor for this hotel and we werenâ€™t surprised when we got there. On a positive note check in was fast and courteous but the hotel itself looks tired and worn. Our room, which was upgraded to a king size bed, was small and dingy. The carpet was so dirty and in dire need of replacement. Noise wasnâ€™t a problem until early in the morning when one could hear the various planes landing and departing. We wore ear plugs which helped and this would be beneficial to anyone staying here in the future. The breakfast room was a good size and a typical run of the mill continental breakfast was supplied. The sun deck area was small with a few deck chairs and a couple of old, dirty looking spas that hadnâ€™t been cleaned in a while for your â€�enjoymentâ€�. There are some fast food options in the airport but for a decent meal you need to take a taxi to the Old Town which is 15 minutes away. Overall the only way I could recommend this hotel is the convenience of being in the airport for a late arriving or early departing flight. This is a hotel that needs its rooms renovated now.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: beeceebee123
Reviews.Content: We booked the airport hotel for a one night stay before leaving for Vieques. Check in was friendly and efficient. As mentioned in many other reviews, the rooms are small and appointed with the basics. Staff were helpful, the beds were comfortable. We walked out of the hotel, got a cab, and were on our way. Knowing we had to spend just 18 hours in San Juan, we were looking for something that was close to the airport, safe, quiet and clean. It met all of our requirements. This is not a hotel that would be comfortable to stay in for any length of time. There is no pool, the hotel itself is not visually appealing, the windows in our room were very small and looked out over the rooftop onto the airport. It worked for us; the price was right, couldn't have been more convenient, and we got a decent night's sleep. (and Vieques...ay yi yi...paradise found)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sparky9345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before and one night after a cruise out of San Juan. The hotel was convenient, and that's the good part. The room was really small, and really cold. We couldn't get the temperature to be comfortable. I checked out the outdoor hot tubs, and they were kinda gross, with lots of dirt/sand sitting on the bottom of each tub. Being near the airport, the noise of the planes could be heard throughout our stay, but once I was asleep it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly noisy and staff were not helpful”
Reviews.Author: laewagne
Reviews.Content: We had a tiny room right across from the elevator, ice machine, and vending machine. We understand these rooms can be pretty noisy but it was unbelievably noisy. Finally at 11pm (we had a 6am flight) my husband went down to ask for another room. They said the hotel was full (ok, I guess that happens). Her solution was to ask if we wanted more pillows. In response, my husband just looked at her, and she then said we should put 'out of order' signs on the machines. She thought we'd have paper, markers, and tape to do this? And at 11:30 pm?? One would think she'd offer to have an employee do this. Then to top it all off at midnight a fire alarm was going off so we walked down 5 flights of stairs only to find a worker saying 'it's ok, we're trying to turn it off'. No apologies were offered in either case. We had a total of two hours of sleep and this room costs $120 per night. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: AD19EW
Reviews.Content: Small room, reasonably priced, average bed comfort, marginal restaurant, very convenient for late night arrival or early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ellen K
Reviews.Content: If you need to fly out early or you are arriving very late, you can't beat staying here! We stayed here in Feb. '12 and the room was clean and adequate. Yes, it's a tiny room, BUT well worth the stay as we had a flight departure at 6:30 AM. Just leave your bags packed when you arrive the night before and pretty much just roll out of bed and you're in the terminal not far from your boarding gate. Since we had rented a car for our 11 day stay in PR, returning it the evening before saved us $$ on the rental, not to mention the near impossibility of returning it that morning and making our flight on time. One of the best decisions we made in all of our travels! I would definitely do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Management”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: Don't ever stay at this hotel if roominess, cleanliness, hot water, customer service, breakfast and ammenities are your thing. We arrived from a very late trip last week at 2:30am. Our plan was to stay until around 10am and check out after eating a quick "complimentary breakfast" and showering in the morning. None of this happened, and we were treated horribly!!! The check in woman proceeded to help other gentlemen who entered the lobby while we stood there in line. Were we invisible??? The room was the size of a box, if you are claustophobic don't even think about staying here. There were two of us and we were bumping into each other to manuever the room. The bed was hard, and the pillows were terrible. Upon waking up after a very rough few hours of sleep, there was no hot water whatsoever, and when we called to compain the manager was very nonchalant in telling us there was nothing he could do and would not issue us a refund. We then proceeded to try and have the "complimentary" continental breakfast, but again a complete nightmare. We got to the breakfast room and it was closed. When we went back to the room and called the front desk we were told it closed at 10am. However our room clock stated it was only 9:10am. The room clock was not set to the right time and we used that thinking that of course they would have their local time correctly set up on their clock. When I asked the manager about that she said, we are only responsible for the time if you call and ask for a wake up call. I don't know about you but I'm 36 years old and have no problem waking up via alarm clock on my own. I don't require wake up calls, and the clock should have the local Puerto Rican time on it, as people are traveling from all over the world. The halls smelled dingy and everything looked weathered and dirty. The cleanest place was actually the tub that ironically we couldn't use!!! I arrived home and called the Best Western and also did an online complaint and Sharon Gomez (the manager) was most unhelpful and very unsympathetic. She seemed to want to battle me instead of do her job and please the customer. If she would have be just a bit amount of aplogetic I might have felt better, but she wasn't. About 5 minutes in, our call was disconnected. I have called her 3 times after and left messages and she has not returned one call. End of story, no refund and no satisfaction. Thankfully we enjoyed the rest of our trip at the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde which was wonderful!!! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone....Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Purpose”
Reviews.Author: maoflandr
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay an extra day after a cruise, but had an early morning flight home. Although we couldn't check in until after 3:00pm the front desk said we could store our luggage in a locked area while we went to the beach nearby. We took a taxi ($10) to Isle Verde and spent the afternoon on the public beach ($4 rental chair for all day) with access to nearby hotels for food and drink. Upon returning to the hotel our room was ready. It was clean and the beds were fine. The hotel is old and although it has been updated, I think they have done as much to improve it as they can do with the facility. The shower was poor and the TV (a flatscreen HD) was very tiny. The biggest drawback about the location is access to a good restaurant, but getting up in the morning and walking into the terminal is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Never want to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Red_Sox_Lovers
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here due to the late arrival of our differing flights, and desire to meet up prior to departure on our cruise. While the on-airport location was exactly what we were looking for, prices were high, the hotel was dingy, beds were hard, pillows were lumpy and towels were thin. Breakfast in the morning featured brown bananas, canned mixed fruit, and some of the worst coffee I've ever had. My daughter wanted a bottle of water, but found the vending machines on all floors empty. Customer service was non-existent. We needed to receive a document prior to departure, but the hotel fax didn't work. They have a business center with two computers and a printer, but the front desk told us we needed to check out on time and could not use the business center after we did. The clerk's complete indifference to our situation was off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “Location for early flight great - Hotel Dirty , Dingy and small”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirlforever
Reviews.Content: Hi , I did stay in this hotel 3 times starting 25 years ago . Its nice if you arrive in late and leave early as any airport hotel . You could not swing a mouse in the room . Its so dirty looking . I did not remove shoes until between sheets - turned off AC so i did not need bed cover ! Breakfast was the worst I have ever had ( thats saying a lot!!) Id stay at a close airport next time - Most cab rides about 15 dollars if no aipport shuttle . Check in person friendly . Hotel needs a major overhaul .

Reviews.Title: “Convenience at the cost of Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: missjr
Reviews.Content: This was super convenient for our late night arrival and early departure from the airport. The room was not the cleanest and the continental breakfast was mediocre. This is a good place to stay if you are just looking for a place to crash and do little else. Don't expect much in terms of amenities. Our room had the smallest TV I've ever seen in a hotel (12 inch flat screen- a Michael Scott special).

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night”
Reviews.Author: SBinPhx
Reviews.Content: Our long flight to San Juan arrived very late at night. It was so convenient to walk a few steps and drop our bags in our room and just get some rest. This hotel is pretty much located above the American Airlines terminal. Check in was easy, and check out was even easier. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was small, but clean. We slept soundly. The next day we had their complimentary breakfast, hopped on the car rental shuttle downstairs and proceeded with our plans. I highly recommend staying at this hotel if your flight arrives very late at night or if it leaves early in the morning. Traffic in San Juan is horrible and if you don't want to deal with it, this hotel is a godsend.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect.....”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: We were "allowed" to stay here unexpectedly after US Airways cancelled our flight. Their door posted rate is $250 (yikes, I hope nobody pays half that!!) but we stayed free with the voucher. The nice thing is it is connected the terminal (near American) so very convenient for the airport. They advertise themselves as 2-3 star hotel, and I would agree and rate them on that expectation. Positive - Very friendly staff. Even called to confirm our wake-up call was successful - Free cookies at check-in - Free continental breakfast - In room coffee machine - Decent looking free gym. Concerns - Very compact little room. - Tiny TV, probably smallest I have ever seen in a hotel - Poor drain on shower and sink - Thin walls, you hear everything from your neighbors - They had huge drapes over the window with hang over your head in bed. Just weird to look up into the middle of a huge clump of drapes in bed. Summary No big issues and about what I would expect at a 2-3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: neblud
Reviews.Content: My wife had stayed here previously so I decided to give it a try before an early morning (6:30 AM) flight. The hotel is on the departure level next to the American Airlines terminal. The access is somewhat strange as one must negotiate about 12 stairs down and the small lobby is not visible to the right. I have some physical issues and fortunately a policeman helped carry my heavy luggage down and when I left at 4:30 AM the woman on the front desk came out of the lobby and carry my bags up the stairs. The room was modest (somewhat narrow) but the bathroom was excellent. There was a flat screen tv on the wall but it was the size of my laptop. There was no chain on the door although it was configured for one. There is a restaurant/bar on the second floor. The small menu is mainly sushi so that is what I had followed by cheesecake. Lovely combination and quite good. All the people at the hotel were very nice and quite helpful. You are, however, away from restaurants and the beach so it is really just a place to sleep and I retired at 8 PM.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Puerto Rico if you want to be close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Davetheprotraveler
Reviews.Content: As soon as I landed in PR, all I wanted to do is get to my room, unpack, and relax. Well, that's exactly what I was able to do thanks to the wonderfully group of people the Best Western has. It's located at the airport, has great rooms, and for the value, you can't beat it. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoKC
Reviews.Content: We chose and booked this hotel for a one night stay the evening before we cruised out of San Juan. Most of the hotels down by the cruise terminal were fully booked, or extremely expensive (it turns out that the weekend we were there happened to be the same weekend as the San Sabastian Festival, which draws 150K-200K people to Old San Juan). We booked this hotel through the AAA website and booked 3 rooms (1 double queen, and 2 single kings). It turns out that the AAA site offers rooms that are not available at the actual hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, the clerk told me that they could only offer 3 single queens. After much discussion with her and her manager (by phone), they gave us a fourth room for free and discounted two of the single queens that should have been kings even more. Needless to say, this helped the rating of the establishment. The hotel was clean, and there is free wifi on every floor. The front desk and staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was merely breads, fruits, and cereals, but it was free and constantly replentished in spite of the crowd. It was easy to get a van to take our group to the terminal. There was a hopping medium sized sports bar across the street that served food and cold beer and had lots of televisions called Buffalo Wings. Best option for watching a game and getting a bite. This hotel is listed on some travel websites as having a casino, but it does NOT anymore. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are needing a one night stay before or after a cruise out of SJ. Very inexpensive and simple hotel, which is just what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo1490
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel to stay the night before we boarded a cruise in San Juan in late January 2012. Our flight arrived around 8pm on a Saturday and we were looking for a place to crash before heading to the port on Sunday around noon. This hotel is literally at the airport, from the baggage claim you'll need to go outside and up a ramp to the hotel entrance. There were signs to direct you once you got outside. We booked a Queen room for a great managers special rate, which included continental breakfast, and free wi-fi. I found the hotel to be very clean. The room was small, but adequate for a one night stay, It is probably on par with a 2.5 star hotel. There is a Buffalo Wings sports bar (not Buffalo Wild Wings as has been reported) across the street from the hotel and also a Wendy's. We we had a nice dinner followed up by a frosty from Wendy's which was very convienent. Continental breakfast was basic but good, fairly standard fare with cereal, fruits, hard boiled eggs, breakfast breads, coffee and juices. Overall we had a nice stay and we would stay here again Pre-cruise, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “What a drag + it's really dark!”
Reviews.Author: siouxtw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there overnight between a late flight from Chicago and a very early one to the island of Vieques the next day, because there were no more flights to Vieques on that date -- which we knew ahead of time. So we had planned our trip to do it this way, since we'd spent plenty of time in the airport in San Juan (SJU) between flights to and from Vieques over the years and had enjoyed the roulette tables in the casino in the hotel. (I usually at least break even.) We figured we'd spend an hour or so in the casino, have dinner, maybe watch some TV and go to sleep. The hotel restaurant's menu -- and the restaurant itself -- looked pretty unappetizing, very dark and way over-priced, so we wound up eating junk food and food we'd brought with us for the trip. Even the junk food places close down pretty early. The room itself was remarkably uncomfortable to spend time in awake: dark walls in a teeny-tiny room. If one didn't have claustrophobia before, this would do it! It was too uncomfortably small to even try to watch the TV mounted in a weird place on the wall or to read! And it was so dark! I am not one who likes a lot of light: we keep the lighting very low at home and in "our" rental casa. I have no clear memory of a pool (or maybe it was across from the "breakfast room"?): just... nothing to do and nowhere to go. I'm unsure where other reviewers found a pool, or maybe it was just too forgettable. Perhaps the worst part was that the casino had been closed down -- not for renovations, as posted, but because people were going through TSA twice: to get to their gate and get "settled in", coming back out to visit the casino, and then going through TSA a second time. (I tend to ask lots of questions of strangers and get the "real scoop.") It was still closed on the next trip, and on our most recent trip (12/11) it was totally gone. So there was truly nothing to do -- unless we wanted to cab it to a casino, and we didn't -- especially for just an hour or so, after a long day of uncomfortable flying. Also, we were in "island mode": no dressy clothes, etc. Our plan had been to just stay put at SJU, go to bed early and catch our early AM flight. Never again. We would take a cab to a place we stayed on another trip to Vieques (Le Consulat) or somewhere else -- anywhere else! Oh, but it seemed clean enough -- from what we could tell in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladtvtxrider
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before our southern Carribean cruise..clean, great staff, and saves leaving airport if you already have transferrs to boat..the rooms are small and bathroom is short on counter space, but is extremely clean, free breakfast, free interenet service add a nice touch. This is not a five star hotel, but is a great place to stay before or after a trip..I will stay again if we leave from this cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “It made our trip easier”
Reviews.Author: Lottomaxwinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 2012 with our four children. Had a morning flight to catch and it just made our life a lot easier to be right at the airport. We got a double queen deluxe room, it wasn't luxurious but it was clean and the beds were comfy. The TV was a super tiny flat screen mounted on the wall, the bath tub was very small too but at least there was hot water and it was clean. The rooms have free wifi which was nice. There were restaurants open in the airport that we fed our kids at and then we tried the Hotel Bistro on the 2nd floor alone. They serve sushi, sandwiches, wraps, and have a bar, the staff were friendly and the food was decent. Their breakfast room is on the 2nd floor and opens at 5am. I thought the breakfast was good, cereal, oatmeal, muffins, croissants, pastry's, bananas, hard boiled eggs, toast, juice, fruit salad, and they even had a nescafe machine with cappucino's etc. I recommend this hotel only if you need to stay for 1 night to catch a flight, otherwise stay closer to the Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible front desk staff at the time”
Reviews.Author: rurka
Reviews.Content: We checked in with 30 of us arriving for a cruise. When we arrived the front desk staff were very unaccommodating and not friendly at all. The rooms had a small TV the size of a mini laptop and it was on the wall. Rooms were very very small and cramped. We utilized the pool are to gather with our group with no suggestions from the hotel where we could get together. There was a breakfast and that was good. Overall the hotel was not a good model for the Best Western brand.

Reviews.Title: “single woman left alone after lovers disagreement”
Reviews.Author: dar12341947
Reviews.Content: had followed hotel instuctions to pay via credit card form friends son and said it did not go through. i was alone and single wit h no money accessable.

Reviews.Title: “One Night is Enough....”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight arrival and did not want to hassle with leaving the airport to get to a better hotel so we stayed at BW. The room and bathroom were very small but they were clean. The convenience factor is a big plus. Would definitely stay here again....for one night only...if needed. Also, the staff at the check-in desk were very pleasant and professional. There is a restaurant in the hotel but it was closed when we arrived. We were still on "state" time and hungry so that was kind of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for first time in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Connie P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient for having never traveled to San Juan, and unsure of how to get around town. It was a less than 5 minute walk from baggage claim at the airport. Once we got there, we were surprised that there were no rooms available for us at 5:30, when check-in begins at 3. After waiting for maybe 10 minutes, we had our room. It was all we needed for one night, clean linens, clean bathroom. What we needed was a place to eat, but the dining information was hard to understand, so we went to the taxi kiosk outside and simply told them we needed to eat somewhere reasonable and close by. They recommended an area called Isla Verde, which ended up being a short 5 minute drive. They pointed us in the direction of restaurants, and we ended up finding a great cafe/gelato shop called Piu Bello. They told us there were lots of taxis available up the road when we were ready to get back, which was true, and only about 10$ each way. The next morning we had a simple continental breakfast...nothing too special, but it was sufficient, and more importantly, compliementary. Check out was easy, and we spent the time between then and heading to our cruise ship by playing pool and ping-pong in their game room, which was alot of fun. Liked-convenience, service, cleanliness, game room, free breakfast Disliked-unclear description of dining/entertainment options, having to wait for check-in so late in the day

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, no-frills airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Had a 6:30am flight so returned the rental car and camped here for our last night. Friendly customer service. Had to call down to get an extra pillow (4 were provided), and it arrived about 15 minutes later. Asked for a quiet room, got one at the end of the hall. Didn't eat here and left before the 5am free breakfast. Used the business center, it was clean and computers were fast. We stuck our head in the bar/restaurant and the bartender was friendly. Someone is paying attention to the details here, and it shows. While not luxurious, the room seemed recently renovated and was spic and span, with a nice shower. It is right next to American Airlines and an easy walk to the other terminals, though there's nothing else around here that is an easy walk; I wouldn't stay here for my entire vacation, for instance. I did hear the occasional plane when we first arrived, but we left so early, it was no big deal, but that might be a concern for some during busier landing times. All in all, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great for easy overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: CrankiestOne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you have a late arrival with an early morning connecting flight as I did. I was a solo (female) traveler and wanted a safe and convenient hotel. I felt safe, and one certainly can't beat the convenience. My room reminded me of my visit to Alcatraz--a small space with solid stone walls. I had soup and a sandwich at the bar; food was decent (miso soup was delicious), and service was very good. I slept well and didn't hear any planes. The included continental breakfast was pretty good. They had all the basics plus hard-boiled eggs. Overall this hotel is just worn out. It is in need of an overhaul. But for convenience it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: LGreen564
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband arrived 2 days prior to our cruise leaving from San Juan port and chose Best Western on the San Juan airport as our choice of lodging, primarily because our flight would come in late, and also because we figured since we are at an airport we would find english speaking folks more easily. Since the moment we were greeted (at 1am) all of the staff members we encountered were friendly and warm. The rooms were small in size, but conveniently arranged, so it was nice and comfortable for my husband and I. The hotel is close in proximity to beaches and local shopping so we found it easy to get a cab and get to the fun! There was a hot breakfast bar which I was surprised by, usually this type of hotel doesn't offer hot breakfast, but it was nice. Our stay was fantastic. After our cruise we needed a place to rest since our flight was at 3 am and needed a place to rest for 13 hrs or so, so we stayed at this hotel once more and again all our accommodations were great.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: FarrahMo
Reviews.Content: Booked the night before our cruise from San Juan. Perfectly located outside the airport, 3 minutes walk. When you're exhausted from a late night plane ride, it's the hotel for you! Value for the money is pretty good. Sheets were damp from the dryer, but slept well. Continental breakfast was a plus. No complaints other than that

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that could use some changes”
Reviews.Author: PDM77059
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats the convenience of a hotel located inside an airport. It would have cost 30% more for another hotel (at least) near the airport and the same or more for a hotel away from that location. Nevertheless the hotel has some basic features that are OK. The room itself was clean and bed comfortable. TV is a flat screen that is on the wall and hard to see. No airport noise made this very good and all rooms are well insulated. The bathroom, while clean, had some disgusting hairs on the shower wall and bathtub as well as on the walls near the toilet. Even though the bathroom was clean, this was a downer. Continental breakfast was horrid and you would do better to eat in one of the overpriced airport restaurants. Why dont they just raise the rate here and provide a decent breakfast? It would make a huge difference. Checkin and checkout was fine but if there was more than one person in line for checkin be prepared to wait. Staff was friendly and helpful so all in all this was an OK hotel and good if you need to save some money or are transiting to a cruise ship as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice if You Are in Transit”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to the southern Caribbean which necessitated overnight stays in Puerto Rico both coming & going. For anyone in those circumstances, this hotel is a great choice as it is located at the airport. Staying off site as I have done prior to its opening means fighting San Juan traffic (which is no fun) in order to get back to the airport. Rooms are small (as is the TV), but clean and comfortable. The staff is polite & attentive and check in/out procedures are efficient. There is a restaurant at the hotel with a limited menu and there are also several restaurants in the airport itself as well as a Buffalo Wild Wings & Wendys within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: LCMeyer
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was less than what I expected at a Best Western. The monitor on my laptop was larger than their television. The room lacked any decor and echoed in the room because of the emptiness. The bed was a bit less than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: DrSopa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BW at SJU for one night since our flight came in late. The hotel is within the terminal so there is no need to go out of the airport or dependency on a shuttle to bring you in or out. This hotel is very basic but I was very impressed with the cleanliness and comfort. We had a room with a flat screen TV and free WIFI. The business center was well equipped. They also offered free breakfast which was nice. Overall very good for what is meant to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sandals777
Reviews.Content: It's such a great location, literally right in the airport. The rooms were small but clean enough. We only had a very small tv hung on the wall. Breakfast was ok with the basics. Free wifi. I would stay there again for just an overnight trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worse customer service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dissapointed1966
Reviews.Content: I work for Best Wester privately own in the United States and I had never been treated so bad, thank God we are privately own.they treat their next door employees worse than regular guest, you would think that working for Best western they would feel proud to have others employees, but stead was the WORSE!!! I was expecting many calls from the states from the moment I arrived which was nov6-10, I choose this Hotel because I wanted to expend my Birth day in San juan. Well of all the calls that I was supposed to receive only one came in. Every time I would ask the front desk if I had received any calls, "No one call you" My friends called and were not able to leave a message on the answer machine it kept sending back the call to Front Desk, so they left messages there which I never got.Twise I requested a wake up call never got it, on one of them they ruin my day because i was supposed to meet a tour to the best views in Puerto Rico. I was put in a ran down room, dirty walls with scratches on the walls. They miss House Keeping and when I called, with an attitud they told me if I left the sign on for no disturb! which I had not! I had to reactivate my key 3 times, and to top it all I left with BED BUGS BITES ON MY LEGS!!!! Air conditioner was so high it felt like 20 degrees in the room. I had to turned off to be able to sleep. Great way to get sick, outside was 80-90 degrees then come back to 20. The only two people who were kind and actually felt happy to know that I work in another hotel were Fernando Flo, helps with breakfast and Nayda Castro, works in the breakfast, nice, friendly, helpful, for heaving just continental was good compared to other hotels. I WILL NOT RECOMEND THIS HOTEL TO NO ONE!!! The whole front staff that was there when I was there were rude especially the women with the exception Maricruz the young lady with Long Black hair. The rooms dont have a place to put your clothes, only hangers. So my luggage was my on top of the bed, which in the end the BED BUGS CAME HOME WITH ME!! This Hotel ruin my Birthday Present!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Peekaboo912
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected overnight stay. I was booted from my plane, so the airline put us up in the airport hotel (July 2011). I have to stay from the time we checked in - until the time we left it was very nice. We were greeted by 2 wonderful front desk staff, we ate at the hotel restuarant which had great variety, and we enjoyed the rooftop hot tubs. The room was very clean, but very small - but again it was just overnight-so it worked great for 2 ppl.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a major renovation - 2-1/2*”
Reviews.Author: Jojo_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice, due to flight cancellations while in transit, so too many options on where to stay, not wanting to go to far. This is one of the places the airline put us. The staff are nice, but that is where the 'nice' ends. The place has a mildew smell that no amount of air freshener can seem to cover up. It's hard to control the room temperature. The internet worked, which was nice. BJ's restaurant - staff were accommodating and nice about redeeming vouchers from the airline. The sushi believe it or not is pretty good also. In the end, it is a place to sleep and have a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: cakelv_34
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel. We just stayed there for one night because we had a 6 am flight the next morning, in that sense it was VERY convenient. The room itself is nice, small but nice, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was what I had a problem with, it smelled, the toilet was leaking and the tub floor was broken. There are a few options to eat at the airport. It's a $100 per night which I thought was a little high for the quality but It was ok, I would stay there again if I have to...

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: kariesue
Reviews.Content: We arrived San Juan at 10:30 at night and by the time we got luggage we were so tired from a day of traveling. It was very nice to not have to get transportation, just pull our luggage a short distance to the hotel. The room is SMALL but clean and quiet until morning when planes started landing. The breakfast was basic cereal, toast muffin, coffee machine was broken but attendant kept thermos full for customers. Business center was available with 4 terminals and a printer. A convienent place to sleep and re-fuel.

Reviews.Title: “the air conditioned gypsy”
Reviews.Author: thewandererTortola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at best basic, and as others have said there is little choice for food, however the BJ's Bistro does do a good job of the california roll. The rooms are small and cramped, the carpets dirty and the paintwork has not been updated in years. It is a soulless box. The breakfast is functional, but generates more polystyrene containers than should be allowed. I personally would not choose to stay at this hotel. I was put in the room by AA after being off loaded, and normally if I get the chance ask to be put any where but the Airport hotel. Its also not that cheap if you ever have to pay by your own coin!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: DavidColorado_4
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was so convenient to the airport, with the rental car agency virtually on the same site. It has the standard amenities of a Best Western hotel, with nothing else to distinguish it. The desk staff at check-in was not very friendly, especially considering that it was late and we wanted to find a convenient restaurant. Fortunately, the restaurant on-site was friendly, with cheerful staff and an adequate menu. Since we arrive late in San Juan (after 10:30 pm), the hotel was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Sonia T
Reviews.Content: Dirty commode, and sink was very slow filtering. I was told by the front desk that all the sinks were like that. SMALL room, dirty floor, bed light out in one of the lamps, TV remote control didn't work. Wrong information given at the counter about time to be at the agriculture and AA counter. The Webpage says breakfast starts at 5:00. Actually, it starts at 6, therefore we missed it since our flight was leaving at 6:15. TOO MUCH MONEY FOR THE SORRY EXPERIENCE!!!!!! GO TO THE EMBASSY SUITES in ISLA VERDE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and cheesy, but functional”
Reviews.Author: Rhone_Man
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the Best Western in San Juan airport fulfils the single most important requirement of an airport hotel - it is actually *in* in the airport. Reception is, oh, maybe 100 feet from the American Airlines check in desk. After that, the list of positives is pretty short. The rooms are pretty spartan, and not particularly large. They have the world's smallest TVs, with a very limited selection of channels. The showers are decent, but not great. One hidden gem of the airport is the surprisingly good quality sushi that you can get at the bar. To be honest, I am not sure if that is an official part of the Best Western or not, but it is certainly the best food available in the hotel. The free breakfast is certainly cheap and cheesy. Nothing tells you what class you are travelling quite so much as using plastic cutlery and styrofoam crockery. But there is plenty of it, so at least you don't start your onward journey hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: RoosterTravels
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit small but fit the bill. Bed was comfortable, decor was recent, room was clean. Good free breakfast - fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, toast, boiled eggs... Staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. Would stay again. Internet was slow in our room - perhaps it's better in others? One drawback is there aren't any good restaurants at the airport - took a cab into Old San Juan for about $20.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR A ONE NITE STAY”
Reviews.Author: claireod1
Reviews.Content: I agree the rooms are small, but they contain all you could need, tea/coffee making facilities, iron and iroing board, hairdryer, and inroom safe. They also have free wifi, bussiness centre, and fitness room, as well as sevring a complimentry continetal breakfast, which is more than adequate and all for under $100.00. This is not a 2 week vacation hotel, it is a one nite stop, especially if you have an early morning flight as it is right in the American Airlines terminal. The staff were friendly and efficent. This is my third stay here this year, and will certainly use it again, when I am in transit

Reviews.Title: “At least you don't have to leave the airport on that overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: Ya know, it was very nice not having to sleep in the airport terminal while waiting for a connecting flight to one of the islands. We spent one night heading to Dominica and two nights on our return to the States. The lobby/front desk is small and right outside the American Airlines check-in areas. The elevator is small and the rooms we stayed in were very small. The flat screen TV was, well... a joke! A huge wall with a 15" or 17" flat screen TV barely watchable. The view outside the windows is drab... hey it's at an airport! BUT, the place is clean. It was quiet and reasonably comfortable and the staff was more than friendly and courteous. It really beat sleeping in the terminal. I would stay here again only on an overnight layover. Never for several days visiting San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in a casket!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia50207
Reviews.Content: We had just spent 2 wks. in Rincon and since we had an early (8AM) flight we decided to stay at Best Western at the San Juan airport. BIG MISTAKE! First off once at the airport you must go down a set of stairs to even get to the front desk. Granted the women working the desk were very friendly and DID speak English, but things only got worse from then on. Just trying to get to our room was difficult - the elevator is so slow you could read "War and Peace" completely before it arrives! We were assigned our room - they had us listed for a double, but since it was just my husband and I , I opted for a single. Big mistake! When we tried to get into our room the swipe card would not work. The maids tried with no success. they called the front desk and finally security came and tried and it wouldn't work for them either. Another call down to the desk - finally after many attemps they decided to give us the room next door. On opening the door I felt like I was in a doll house! And not a cute one. They say it had been remodled - the question is when???? We tried to hook into their computer system with no luck at all. Finally about a half hour later their IT man finally came and with a great deal of trouble he finally got our computer up and going. We were forced to eat at the bar and it did cost quite a bit and the selection wasn't all that good. They had sushi but I would not have touched it - it did not look fresh! Since we had no car we were forced to go back to our room (closet) and watch what little TV was available. Nobody told us of any other amenities available at this hotel. We did not find out until the morning when we found - by accident the breakfast room. The food was good and the local coffee great. It was the one good thing about this experience. Sleeping and being forced to stay in that room for the night was like sleeping in a casket! And the bathroom - yes it was clean - but so small it was unbeliveable! It reminded me of some heads on small sailing vessels! The worst thing was that we were stuck in the hotel. We could not go to any of the great shops or food places in the airport due to the TSA screening. Do not stay here unless you have no other choice - especially if you are clostrophobic!. It was an insult to be forced to pay $135 for a 15 hour stay. Never again.... A better option would simply be to go through the screening with the TSA's and sleep in the airport until your flight is ready to take off. At least you could eat a decent meal and the chairs would probably be more comfortable the the bed we had!

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: silarem
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after arriving late afternoon and having to fly next day. My room was small but efficient. It had a great AC, a small TV, plenty of hot water and a coffee pot. Also the WIFI worked great! Breakfast was modest but adequate. I was able to hear my neighbor but fortunately that was not a problem to get a good sleep. My only complaint IS NOT related to the hotel itself but with the fact that if you have no car you canâ€™t go anywhere unless you get one of the expensive taxis that are around. It was really unfortunate to be relatively close to Old San Juan and not being able to take a bus to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealLilyBart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistent~ in cleanliness, room size, amenities, quality of breakfast~ with Best Westerns that I have stayed in other cities. I appreciated the free internet and extended breakfast hours. It is literally right next door (walking distance, even with too much luggage) from the American Airlines baggage claim). The only downside is that I think it is a bit pricey for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for late night arrivals or early departures.”
Reviews.Author: serenity124
Reviews.Content: If time is of the essence, this is definitely a place to consider. It's built within the airport (although a moderate walk to the terminals) and allows you to maximize sleep time if that's what you need. The room we had was clean, with a small flat screen TV and some toiletries available. The area was quiet and the room really dark. Breakfast was simple but plentiful with cereals, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, fruit, juice, pastries... Was really disappointed to see a nescafe machine for coffee, however.... Last but not least, desk staff was polite and efficient getting us checked in/out. Rooms are definitely overpriced by a little, but, you are paying for location. f you do have time to spare for transportation to the airport in the morning, then it would probably be much nicer to stay somewhere else that's in a similar (or less) price range and with less bare bones feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for emergency airport over-nighters”
Reviews.Author: julesinsf
Reviews.Content: Due to a nightmare travel schedule, we ended up having to unexpectedly stay the night in Puerto Rico. Upon arrival, we found the BW just outside of the security gates. They don't open security until 5am, so it's worthwhile to get a room here if you're staying the night...just know that you can't get back IN the airport until the morning. I never checked out the facilities-just the room. It's clean enough, although the TV is miniature. We were so happy for the convenience of the location so this was a huge plus. For food - walk across the street to Buffalo Wings, where you will find an extensive menu (very casual) and a full bar. We didn't check out the restaurant IN the hotel, because a local told us he preferred the Wings place. All in all - stay here if you have a super early flight or are stuck at the airport overnight.

Reviews.Title: “To sum up the room: SMALL!!!”
Reviews.Author: cajundiver
Reviews.Content: This has to be the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The bed is small, the bathroom is small, the TV is small. The room is so small you can barely get 2 suitcases in. I only stayed here due our flight out being cancelled and it was very late at night to try to find something else. I guess it was clean, but it was old, tattered and outdated. The wi-fi didn't work and I was too tired to try the plug in. If I find myself in this position again I think I would take a cab elsewhere. It is right in the Airport and serves its purpose to get you to an early flight. At about $170 I don't think the price was bad for the location but it was a rough night of sleep on an uncomfortable bed that I don't care to repeat in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanDon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the airport in San Juan. It is extremely convenience and the room was clean. The bed was good. This isn't a vacation hotel - it is for an overnight stay between flights.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: chewycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to leave early for Tortola, BVI. The room was fine, and clean. The bar was nice and the bartender and others there we talked to were very friendly. We did not order food, but others were enjoying, so...It is a convenient place to stay over.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have to stay here "DON'T"”
Reviews.Author: herbieBme
Reviews.Content: The only reason anyone should stay here is because their flight was cancelled and they needed to stay at the airport. Staff has a hard time understanding english, they somewhat speak it but don't understand it. It is your "Basic" Motel room at a high price. Forget the "Free" breakfast. Nothing hot except the toast. Coffee sucks! No donuts or waffles. I will pay the extra $12 next time and go to another hotel close by, Whoever heard of the hot tub closing at 6 p.m. for safety reasons, get real ! The so called restaurant is a joke. Beer $5 sandwiches start at $8, there's way better at Subway in the terminal and they have pizza and soup too, open 24/7. Buffalo wings across from hotel is even better for a wide aray of food. B/W you really need to drop this hotel or improve it. AAA rated 2 wonder why !

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: samcitycat
Reviews.Content: We booked this only because we were getting in late at night and needed to drive over to the west coast of PR and didn't want to do so at night. The room had a terrible dampness and mildew smell, and while the bathroom was more or less clean, I still wasn't about to shower in it. I'd only recommend this if you were in a pinch, but if I ever had to do a similar nighter in San Juan, I'd probably look for something close to the airport other than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good if spending night at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Silver2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not fancy, but reasonably priced, clean and perfectly adequate, if you are spending the night at the San Juan airport. It is just a few steps from the American Airlines check-in counter - you don't have to go outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “stay at hampton inn”
Reviews.Author: squire689
Reviews.Content: This was reminiscent of the hostels I stayed in while in Europe in the 1970's but at a much higher price. What a dump, from beginning to end this place should be avoided at all costs. We canceled our reservation on the return leg of our holiday and stayed at the Hampton Inn which is 10 minutes away-- beautiful. We logged a complaint with Best Western and received a letter of apology from the nite auditor of the hotel so you can tell how seriously they regard my opinion. In conclusion I would say that I am amazed that Best Western would licence a place like this as it can only hurt their francise. Doug Hendry

Reviews.Title: “One night stay Hotel, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: travelleralamundo
Reviews.Content: No need to repeat what most reviewers who rated this hotel 4 stars. It's all about expectations. This is a hotel for convenience, not one where you bunk down for a vacation. Its convenient, no frills, rooms are basic, the bathroom is the highlight of the rooms noticeably clean and upgraded. The queen beds were comfortable. The air conditioning was blasting away, thermostat wasn't quite working right, but no real issues. Breakfast was typical continental, limited selection, great coffee machine with capuccino. Check in was a breeze, we asked for extra towels, no issues. Price, any hotel in San Juan is going to set you back serious cash, thats the way it is here in San Juan, you could do worse with some of the non-brand chains.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise...No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Owsaw
Reviews.Content: It is what it is, a small airport hotel. Was pleasantly surprised given the number of negative reviews. These accommodations work. It appears there has been some recent upgrades / renovations. Still, no frills or fluff. It's convenient overnight accommodations. Yes, the rooms are small but all needs and basic comforts were met. Our room was clean, especially the bathroom w/ new floor, wall and ceiling tiles. The carpet was in good shape. The bedding was decent w/ extra pillows. There were two night tables w/ lamps, a desk for the laptop computer w/ free Wi Fi, a very (too) small TV w/ CNN & ESPN, a Cuisinart coffee maker, two luggage racks and a safe. The hotel facilities included a Business Center equipped to print boarding passes, a Fitness Room w/ updated but basic equipment, a cocktail and lighter fare Lounge, well stocked vending machines and an outdoor deck w/ two hot tubs (however no view and noisy). The Breakfast Room was spacious w/ news & sports on two wide swcreen TVs, USA Today and local newspapers. The menu was basicly satisfying w/ fresh fruit, hot oatmeal, bagels, hard boiled eggs, cereals, juice, coffee & tea and all the expected condiments. Again, no frills. It was nice to wake up, shower & shave and just go downstairs to my departure gate. I would not hesitate to recommend, however expectations are a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great selection for convenience to airport”
Reviews.Author: professor54
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast starting at 5:00 am included delicious hot oatmeal, good selection of cold cereals, fruit, bagels, eggs, juices, coffee, etc. Very convenient for early morning flight from Puerto Rico. Saw airline personnel who also stayed there. fitness center and business center also available and free WI FI

Reviews.Title: “Average stay & fine for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: ttiottn1
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay on our first night in Puerto Rico because the apartment we rented was booked for that night; see the Posada Colonial under specialty lodging for that review. Since we were flying in late and based on the ok reviews here, we chose this place. It was fine for one night, we got a AAA rate of $133/night (without tax) and I would stay here again but only for flying in or out. We got a room with two double beds. The room was ok size; not tiny but not spacious either. It was fine for two adults but four people of any size would have felt cramped. The bathroom was small but there was hot water when needed and the water pressure was excellent. We were on the 4th floor and the view from our room was of the mechanicals on the roof of the 3rd floor; not scenic at all. The room was clean and everything appeared to work, though we did not use the coffeemaker. The roomâ€™s heating/cooling unit worked just fine and was very quiet. The room was also very soundproof; even being at the airport, we could not hear the planes from our room and we did not have problems with noise from the hall. The beds, pillows and linens were fine; we had no problems sleeping. The free continental breakfast was fresh fruit, canned fruit in syrup, cold cereal, pastries, juice, yogurt, milk, and coffee & hot chocolate from a machine. The hot items were oatmeal and hard boiled eggs. Everything was acceptable and edible; nothing to rave about but it will fill you up for breakfast. The place gets crowded but the staff kept items stocked. However, someone spilled something on the tile floor and my sister almost slipped and fell because of it; it took a good 10 mins before the staff cleaned it up. There is also a restaurant on site, BJ's Bistro; see it for my review. On the 4th floor there is an outdoor patio area with 2 four person tubs; one warm, one cold though neither had any jets you could turn on. The deck also had tables with chairs and deck chairs. It was a nice place to hang out and soak up the warm, sunny Puerto Rico weather while we waited for our ride. There are also wash machines & dryers to do your laundry but we did not use them so don't know how good they are. Finally check in and check out were terrible. Checking in we had to wait because someone fell on the stairs to the front desk from the airport and he was bleeding. This clearly frazzled all the staff. They told us that had never happened before. Check out was even worse. We saw no â€œself check outâ€� option and with a mass of people trying to check out (50+ all at once), it took us a Â½ hour to get through the line. The check in/out area is very small so that did not help. What a mess! Luckily we were not in a hurry either time. So if you need to stay at the airport, this will fit the bill and I would stay here again. But I donâ€™t recommend it for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable for one-night airport layover”
Reviews.Author: FengSui
Reviews.Content: If your flight requires an overnight in San Juan and you want to save the time and trouble of taking a taxi into town for the night, this airport hotel is fine for this purpose. You might get a couple extra hours of sleep before your early morning departure. The American Airlines counter is just steps from the hotel desk. The hotel is old, but the bathroom in our tiny room seems to have been updated. The room has working wi-fi and TV. It's quiet, clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower worked, good hot water pressure. The accommodations are basic, but all you need for a good night's rest. The room, for me, would be too small for any longer stay. Check-in took minutes, the front counter staff was friendly and efficient. The on-site sushi bar (BJ's Bistro) was surprisingly good. The sushi was fresh and professionally made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: SantaClara_9
Reviews.Content: It took 2 hours just to check in. I had made reservations, had an email with confirmation number they could not find my reservation, The room temparature extremely low had to sleep with sweater and still could not warm up. Not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: RTHolt
Reviews.Content: we had an unexpected layover in san Juan thanks to a screw up by American airline. They covered the cost of the hotel-i dont know the actual cost of the room so my rating on value is not truly accurate. the room is small and yes like others say the tv is tiny, but when all you are looking for is a clean room and comfy bed, this hotel was great. we had a late bite to eat at the restaurant and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only reason you'd stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Thanh456
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. The only reason you would stay here is if you didn't know any better. It's location is great if you have an early morning departure or a late night arrival. But you'll have a better nights sleep probably anywhere else. Spend the $15 for a cab ride to another hotel. The hotel smelled dank, the rooms were small & smelly, the bed was hard, the shower head was really short (perfect for the average 10yr old), & the 'breakfast' wasn't worth the walk down the hall to the dining room. The front desk staff was very unhelpful, the internet didn't work (& we didn't bother to call for help since we knew we wouldn't get any anyway). In some ways it was the best place to stay before heading home. By the morning, I was ready to leave & couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: joewhite57
Reviews.Content: The description indicates it is an AWARD Winning Hotel......don't miss the part that says it is in the 2 star category. I really don't think that it qualifies for a two star. They did not have extra pillows, towels. The TV was a 13inch. The room was way small. The sad part is the Hotel charged 150.00 a night......NOT EVEN CLOSE TO BEING WORTH IT! We stayed four nights before staying at the BW at the Condado in San Jaun for $180.00 which was an awesome Hotel on the Ocean....this was also with an Ocean View room. Do not waste your $150.00 on the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless just using as layover stop”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelFarNWide
Reviews.Content: As the only hotel located in the airport, it's extremely convenient for a 1-night layover. If you're going to spend more than 12 hours here, you're probably better off elsewhere. The rooms are extremely small and getting rather shabby. The free breakfast is better than nothing but not much better. The airplane noise is not a problem, but loud conversations in the hallway at night are disruptive. Wake up calls are not reliable so be sure to set the alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location every thing else is thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: fdoamerica
Reviews.Content: For $179 a night we got grungy carpets, a run down tired building, a small room with rug stains and a feeling of the room not being clean, small dbl bed with old gray sheets and lumpy pillows, a wifi that would not work, one overworked receptionist (no other support staff) and a breakfast that consisted of instant coffee, bread and cereal ... hey what is not to like. NOT Recommended unless, you have money to throw away and need a place to crash for the night before your early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it unless locations is extremely important.”
Reviews.Author: mhutch60
Reviews.Content: Hot tubs were both cold. Sun deck full of fumes and noise from the airport and hotel air system. Fitness room needed repair. "High speed" wireless internet had bad connection and kept crashing. Walls in the room were dirty. TV screen smaller than my laptop computer. More security guarding the breakfast room than the entire hotel. We are on a tropical island and the breakfast fruit choices were green bananas and canned oranges. Worst Best Western I have ever stayed at. It is connected to the airport but you would be better off staying in Isla Verde and taking a $10 taxi to airport (plus $1 per luggage piece) Tiny room. The towels, bedding and pillows were all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and easy to airport for early flight”
Reviews.Author: nancy_knows
Reviews.Content: Because of our 6 am departure, I chose to spend our last night at the airport. I was pleasantly surprised at how easily our cab driver delivered us to the door of the Best Western hotel (we flew in from Isla Grande airport), the welcoming staff, the cleanliness of the room, the business room with free wi-fi and use of a printer for our boarding passes. It was all so easy. A noisy family with young children next door kept me up for maybe ten minutes. It was not cheap, but worth the hassle-free morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: muskrat2
Reviews.Content: The hotel gets a high 3 and the convenience a 5. We had read the reviews that said the hotel was hard to find, so we asked about this on the tripadvisor forum. Two people responded and told us we would have no problem. Walk out the front door after baggage claim, take a right and follow the signs--you can't miss it. They were right. If you can't find this hotel, well--you're going to get lost a lot. Safety is not an issue, with lots of security around--it's an airport. We stayed two nights, one at the start and another at the end of a vacation to the DR. This hotel worked out well for us. The first night we touched down at 12:18 AM after a long day of travel. We were in our room by 12:45 AM. It couldn't have gone any better. On the way home, we arrived around 3:30 PM, printed our boarding passes for the next day and were set to go (we had a little problem with the printer and both the hotel manager and his IT guy showed up to help us). With some time to kill we sat in the hot tube for awhile which, while not fancy, was clean and enjoyable. For the evening meal, we walked directly across the street to Buffalo Wings Bar and Grill. The food was good and the beer was half the price you would pay at the airport. We got to sleep in an extra hour the next morning before catching our 8:30 AM flight. While the rooms weren't big, they were all we needed (we have certainly stayed in much smaller). Both rooms, along with the bathrooms, were clean and the flatscreen TV was just the right size. The breakfast was adequate and all staff were friendly. If you plan an extended stay in PR this would not be the place, but for an overnight between flights or a handy connection to the cruise port (you only have to pay for one taxi ride) it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: vigiequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel between flights - our morning flight was at 8am so we didn't want to have to trek in from an outside hotel with two small children in the wee hours of the morning. All staff we encountered seemed ultra friendly and helpful - check in was great, the woman in the breakfast room in the morning was really helpful and made me a tray out of a muffin box to help me carry my food back to the room, and the waiter at BJ's bistro was friendly too. The room was basic, there is no getting away from it - you are paying for location. But it did the job. My only really complaint was the paper thin walls. Our next door neighbour was having a loud phone call at 10.30pm and we could hear every word he said (shouted?). However, due to this, I wasn't too worried about the noise we made while we were leaving at 6am.....

Reviews.Title: “your basic airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyelaine
Reviews.Content: stayed here both pre and post cruise. they charged us 109 usd per nt, but this feels inflated by about 20-30 bucks. it's very basic, but breakfast is included as is wi-fi (albeit a very slow connection) ... staff very much a mixed bag - we encountered really great front desk personnel as well as bottom of the barrel. overall, convenience trumped style and hipness. i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find, dirty, seedy hotel”
Reviews.Author: 35islandgirl
Reviews.Content: We pre booked this hotel ahead of time thinking it would be perfect because our flight got in from Chicago after 9pm and we were leaving the next morning at 10am. The hotel is unbelievably hard to find, because the airport has some of the hallways closed and locked off. When we did find it we found a grouchy older woman who nearly threw the keys at us. The room wa marginally clean. One light bulb was out, the phone didn't work. Free internet did not work. I could barely stand to be in the room so we went up to the little "bar" and had a drink. It was fine, and the Asian man who served us was very friendly. The continental breakfast in the am was ok and the staff was cheerful, but I won't stay in those rooms again. Absolutely disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Fast check in..friendly and clean..Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: EasygoinAuthentic
Reviews.Content: Having been through PR dozens of times...inevitably, American screws your flights and you need a last minute place to stay! I was checked in, in my room and drawing a bath in under 2 minutes...no joke. Room was spotless and breakfast was better than a continental. muffins, oatmeal, boiled eggs, different types of toast, bagels, 3 different cold cereals, canned fruit was not great, but hey, juices, all different kinds of specialty coffees..mochachino, caps,lattes, cocoas, from a press button machine...but, still a lot of choice..... the gym is good, a casino and everyone is sooo nice. I think if there was a problem they would fix it right away. Overall for a last minute overnite....great!

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Night at a very seedy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marineflyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in San Juan. The Hotel is located near the American Airlines Counter in the airport. We checked in and were assigned a room that was very damp. It smelled of mildew and the sheets were torn and thin. The bed was damp and we slept in our clothes. The bathroom was very basic and the tiles were not clean. The carpet smelled and it was funky to walk on it with bare feet. The continental breakfast was a joke. Just nothing was appealing. Please do NOT stay at this hotel. It just is not worth the $147 a night we paid. We could not leave fast enough the next day for our cruise on the Celebrity Millennium. The room on the Millie was absolutely spotless and the bed sheets were new. A 180 degree difference. I would have rather slept in the airport in a seat than ever stay in this flea bag hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you arrive late and have an early AM flight”
Reviews.Author: No.1 Arrow
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San Juan on a late flight and flew out the next morning. I would only reluctantly stay here again under those circumstances. The tiny lobby is accessed from the airport terminal via a labyrinth-like route, passing tired-looking rooms filled with slot machines and signs advising that the "casino" is closed for renovations. It resembled a taxi dispatch office rather than a hotel lobby. My room was tiny, its dimensions reminding me of a Japanese "business hotel" room but with less charm and not as scrupulously clean. It was very cramped - and I was travelling alone! The tv was flat screen but its size matched the room, and only 3 or 4 of the few channels were in English. Breakfast was offered in a drab, windowless room overseen by a grumpy looking woman. The offerings matched the ambience of the room. I was happy to grab my luggage and head off to catch my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, air conditioner on steroids, conveniently located in airport”
Reviews.Author: Semibum
Reviews.Content: This hotelâ€™s best (maybe only) feature is its location right in the airport. The rooms are very small and the air conditioning systemâ€™s thermostat does not seem to work. The system must have been designed for a much larger room. The result is that when in bed, you are constantly blasted by a stream of cold air which soon brings the room down to meat locker temperature â€“ and you will be in the bed since there is little else in the room. Your only defense is to turn the system off, which after a while makes for a stuffy scene. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times now and may do so again when we have a very early departure. Location is a decent trade-off for the other drawbacks if you have a very early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Service! Would Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Angiet2
Reviews.Content: Thanks to American Airlines doing us dirty, we ended up in San Juan overnight, unexpectedly. I remembered that there was a Best Western Hotel at the airport, and after reading some not so great reviews, decided that I was going to give it a shot anyway, due to the hotelâ€™s great airport location (no cabs to deal with!). Thanks to Costcoâ€™s website, we were able to save 20% off AAA rates! Our total room rate for 2 Queen Beds, Non-Smokingâ€¦$140â€¦ Not bad, considering they know that they have a captive audience. Of course, I would have preferred the Ritz Carlton San Juan, BUT, I must tell youâ€¦ this hotel tries hard to rise above their Best Western reputation. The check in was fast and friendlyâ€¦ The 4:00 AM wakeup call arrived 5 minutes early, and then a reminder wakeup call came at 4:15 AM (nice touch!!). The complimentary breakfast was a nice touchâ€¦ No, itâ€™s not Sunday Brunch at the Waldorf, but hey, when itâ€™s 5:00 AM, a hot bagel, oatmeal, cereal and tons of hot beverages to choose from, looks pretty darn good. Our room was spotlessly clean. Bathroom was clean (small, but clean). Hotel offers coin-op laundry, which could be handy for cruise travelers coming home with a ton of dirty laundry. They also have coffee in the room, along with free Wi-Fi. The gym had new treadmills, free weights, and a stairmaster. Did not get to use the Casino, but it looked like it could be a fun way to spend a little time (tons of slot machines). I would absolutely stay here again! If you are laying over in San Juan, and have an early flight the next day, this is a GREAT choiceâ€¦ You are steps away from the American Airlines ticket counter.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: coquiOmaha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our flight into San Juan and again before our flight out of San Juan. If your flying out early or arriving late this hotel is very convenient as it is right at the terminal. Pretty basic hotel but very nice staff and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very nice, room clean & quiet”
Reviews.Author: Quirkie
Reviews.Content: My flight cancelled due to snow closing Atlanta airport. Had stayed before when arriving very late. I spent the day, used the fitness room, enjoyed the deck, walked in the airport and found several places to eat and a few shops. Had a great Margurita and a turkey wrap in B J's. Stairwells were clean and I did not smell or see cigarettes, as one reviewer complained about. Free breakfast not much to brag about and few choices on TV, but I would stay again in the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Location convenience barely offsets cost of going elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LeanCEO
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel actually inside the San Juan airport, so it is very convenient if you arrive late one evening to fly out early the next morning - it will save you a couple cab rides. The rooms are tiny and noisy, the glorious "BJ's Bistro" (nice name...) is a square room with a couple palm trees painted on the wall, the breakfast area is tiny and impossible to find a seat at normal hours. But then again, if you just need a bed for a few hours, can sleep easily with hallway and plane noise, and don't need much for breakfast, this will work. I will say the business center isn't too bad and will let you print out boarding passes for free. Free high speed internet, but it would really slow down during peak hours. If you have some extra time, but still don't need a beach, take the 5 minute cab ride ($12 each way) to the Hampton. Brand new, beautiful rooms, great pool.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: FreeheelgirlCA
Reviews.Content: I had a res. at BW for what turned out to be the night after the earthquake in Haiti. Needless to say, I missed my reservation as I was stuck in Haiti. When I did get out of Haiti and had a layover in San Juan airport (was still on my way to a wedding in the BVIs), I decided I would like to clean up a bit, as I had not been able to shower in Haiti for 5 days. I went to BW and told them my story.
