All they said was that my room had been non-refundable and that though they did not offer a day rate any longer, they would allow me to pay day rate this one time. So, after losing $140 for the night I missed, I then had to pay another $100 to take a shower. Got to love the compassion, I have tried to track down the owner to discuss and have emailed the former chair of the board for BW region (Bonnie McPeake) and have not heard a word back. BEYOND disappointed in the hotel itself and in BW corporate. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS HOTEL! If/when I hear from the owner and/or board and they refund me atleast a portion of my money, I will rescind this negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Hazard to Health”
Reviews.Author: LeeBeeCapeCODMA
Reviews.Content: This 100% smoke free hotel smells like the inside of an ashtray. Cigarette butts in the stairwell, room 607 smelled of smoke and mold sufficient to cause nausea. The 10" flat screen tv was a joke - maybe 10 stations, 3 in English, no casino and charged +$180. This is a true embarrassment to the Best Western name. Avoid this place at any cost - there are many cheaper, far better hotels a $10 cab ride away in Isla Verde. The worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: tyjune
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight layover from the Dominican. After reading some of the other reviews I was scared of what we might encounter. But I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was clean, but small (as expected). No problem if you just need a room to lay down for on an overnight layover or just to get some rest. Its not some place you would stay long term, but for our purpose it was more than sufficient. It was extremely convenient as it was located right in the terminal where we flew out of.

Reviews.Title: “Wouln't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: praise_5
Reviews.Content: This was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in! For $144.00 we should have at least gotten a 2 bed room instead we got a King size bed and we had 3 kids. The bathroom was so small I could sit on the toliet ,wash my hands in the sink and my feet in the tub at the same time! And the t.v. was about the size of my laptop with about 4 channels and only one was in english. I realize I should expect that but this is an international airport. I would never stay again or gp back to San Juan Puerto Rico again!

Reviews.Title: “There's gotta be a better place”
Reviews.Author: Cnash
Reviews.Content: We too HAD to stay at this *modest* hotel because of a missed flight. American Airlines helped us miss our connection to St. Thomas AND lost our luggage. We thought we were being smart by packing 2 carry-on bags only to be told the flight was full and our regulation carry-on bags were too big. They were checked on at the gate and had all our essentials in them, i.e. toothbrushes, toothpaste, brushes, razor. When we arrived at SJU we waited for our luggage to show. Nada. The Hotel nor the airline offered any amenities. Fortunately I had my essentials in my backpack and shared what I had with my hubby. Anyway, with that off my chest, the room was tiny, sparsely furnished, with just enough room to squeeze on either side of the bed. There was a tiny TV mounted on the wall (adorable), and a tiny bathroom, no closet but a small rack to hang a couple of things on. I would had been infuriated to have to pay for this room. So glad American paid the tab. And the so-called restaurant only had small snack items. Since we arrived so late a small something to eat was not a bad idea, but our vouchers were for only $10 each. That almost paid the tab. Food was forgettable. The only perk was that it was IN the airport, which was great for our early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westernâ€”some due fairness given”
Reviews.Author: mirkovh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel even after reading all the horrible reviews on Trip Advisor because of its convenient location, and thought we would just make it through the night there. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and had all the amenities one expects from this type of hotel chain, including a flat-screen TV with cable and alarm clock. The bathroom was brand new, with a hairdryer, clean towels, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner and hand soap. The beds were comfortable with clean linens and quilts. The receptionist checked us in promptly and had a friendly attitude. Altogether, we had a nice one-night stay in a quiet and pleasant environment. In the morning we woke up well rested and ready for the next leg of our trip. We would recommend this hotel to our friends with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “This Convenient Transit Passenger Haven works”
Reviews.Author: RexMundo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to catch some Z's before your next day flight to other islands. The staff is friendly and professional, and this baby is located in the Airport Lobby! There is even a stingy pay out casino in the hotel. I live in Hawaii, but go sailing in the Carib and it lets me unwind with a small TV and air-conditioning. You would never spend your honeymoon here, however for a good nights sleep you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay, as long as it's a VERY short stay.”
Reviews.Author: tcm_crew
Reviews.Content: Very dated, old, and in dire need of a makeover. Typical kind of slummy airport hotel. Fills up with passengers displaced from canceled and overbooked flights. It was especially annoying that a hotel whose bread and butter is displaced airline passengers (there was, at times, a line of displaced passengers awaiting check-in which snaked out the front door and into the airport), but the hotel didn't have amenity kits. Consequently, with no disposable toothbrush, no toothpaste, no small deodorant stick, I'm just going to stink today, I suppose. The property is 100% smoke-free, so at least the play doesn't smell like an ashtray. The rooms are small, and somewhat moldy smelling. The on-site restaurant is BJ's Bistro. I had the sushi, which wasn't bad, but the other menu offerings were very limited - typical burgers and BLT. The free high-speed wireless internet was nice, but during waking hours the broadband must be getting eaten up as it slows to a near-useless standstill. There's no reason to stay at this hotel unless you've either got a very early flight, or are staying on an airline voucher. It's adequate for an overnight stay, but I'd definitely not make plans on intentionally landing at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fine option for staying the night before a flight, but not much appealing”
Reviews.Author: bugleTA
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and it really is right by the terminal. Since that's all I cared about I would consider staying there again. Definitely not a pretty place but fine for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Rosalou
Reviews.Content: Our connecting flight was cancelled, Amnerican Airlines put us up in the Hotel. The word public bathroom comes to mind when I think of of our room because thats what it smelled like. I was so happy to catch our flight out of there the next day.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather spend the night in jail”
Reviews.Author: indiedavid
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world for over 12 years and this was the most dismal place I have been. The hotel is aged and the rooms are only about 125 square feet. The beds are terrible, the place is noisy, the internet doesnt work and the tv is about 12 inches wide. We were forced to stay here due to a mechanical problem with a Delta aircraft. Under no other circumstances would I suggest anybody stay here. We did keep a good sense of humor but unfortunately thats all this place is good for, a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Langroch
Reviews.Content: Employees were nice and helpful but the rooms are very noisy and we were squeezed between 2 noisy rooms. You can't beat the location when you have a flight at 6 am but this is the only reason you should stay here because otherwise its not a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Had no other choice-which is the only way I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: davisaim855
Reviews.Content: Our flight from San Juan to St. Croix USVI was canceled due to mechanical problems and rescheduled for the next morning, so we were given a room at the San Juan Airport Hotel and Casino for a night. Now, I'm sure us "unscheduled layover" people are given the cheapest rooms available but this wasn't even a room, more like a mausoleum. The first thing we noticed was the room had a terrible smell, really terrible; like cigarette smoke and decomp; it was pretty bad. There was nothing on the walls except a pitiful 10-12-inch flat panel TV which you needed some serious specs to be able to see. The walls were bare, flat beige and with the curtains drawn, it gave you the feeling of being in a panic room or bomb shelter. For what it's worth, the staff was courteous and the hotel was a 5-minute walk through the airport to our gate the next morning. The Subway restaurant in the airport was still open, so we just ate a sandwich and went to bed. This hotel is not for vacationers, business people or anyone who has their choice of hotels in San Juan. This hotel is just a touch better than sleeping in a chair in an airport to wait for your next flight and if we had to pay for the room, we would have done just that.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay if you overnight in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: FL2007
Reviews.Content: We were faced with a sudden flight change from American Airlines and had to overnight in San Juan. On previous visits, we took a taxi to a resort, spent the night and then taxi back to the airport. There are no resort courtesy vehicles in San Juan. This time we opted for the Best Western and were very pleased. The room rate was less than we had paid a month before at a resort and no taxi fares. You are right at the airport so you can eat at the bistro at the resort or walk into your choice of places at the airport. The room was clean, quiet and the staff was super! Make it easy on yourself. Spend the night within steps of your departure gate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Idea!”
Reviews.Author: LLuetje
Reviews.Content: This really is the best place to stay if you have an early flight the next day. We dropped off the rental car and they took us right to the front door. The price was great and this was the best Best Western I have ever stayed at. I was expecting a sort of sketchy lace but it was clean, updated and very comfortable. There were two restaurants within walking distance. to my surprise, the hotel also had a fitness room (with newer equipment), a nice breakfast lounge for a free continental breakfast starting as early as 5:30 am, a game room--with pool table--as well as a hot tub room. I really was impressed with how nice the hotel was considering it was located in the airport as was so inexpensive. Clearly the location is great because it's easy to get on a flight, there are no scenic views or illusions of beach front but we never heard a plane and the convenience was awesome! I will most definitely stay here again the night before I fly out.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: JacksonzMom
Reviews.Content: The only reason anyone should book this hotel is if they need to be near the airport for an early flight. I was trying to get home a day early and had to go standby on an American Airlines flight. After I couldn't get on I ended up booking this hotel. This hotel is way overpriced but they can get away with it because of the convenience of being right in the airport. The rooms are clean but very narrow. The LCD is smaller than my computer screen which was crazy. The continental breakfast was basic danishes, bagels and hot and cold cereal. There would be no reason for me to ever pay to stay here again, so unless American has to put me up here (which they do for travelers stranded by them) then I would opt for a hotel near the beach.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN San Juan Airport Hotel
